qas.question: What backup element is still found on Windows 8?
How is Backup and Restore opened?

answers.text: through a Control Panel applet called "Windows 7 File Recovery"
access previous versions of shared files stored on a Windows Server computer

qas.question: What backup element isn't still found on Windows 8?
What backup element is still found on Windows 9?

plausible_answers.text: through a Control Panel applet called "Windows 7 File Recovery"

qas.question: How isn't Backup and Restore opened?

plausible_answers.text: through a Control Panel applet called "Windows 7 File Recovery"

qas.question: How is Backup and Restore closed?

plausible_answers.text: access previous versions of shared files stored on a Windows Server computer

context: <a0_0><b4_0><b5_0>Backup and Restore<b5_0/><b4_0/><a0_0/>, the backup component of Windows, is deprecated. It still ships with Windows 8 and continues to work on preset schedules, but is pushed to the background and can only be accessed <a1_0><b6_0><b7_0>through a Control Panel applet called "Windows 7 File Recovery"<b7_0/><b6_0/><a1_0/>.:76 Shadow Copy, a component of Windows Explorer that once saved previous versions of changed files, no longer protects local files and folders. It can only <a2_0><b8_0>access previous versions of shared files stored on a Windows Server computer<b8_0/><a2_0/>.:74 The subsystem on which these components worked, however, is still available for <a3_0>other software<a3_0/> to use.:74
